clinical_study.brief_title: The Application Value of Non-contact Infrared Thermometers in Temperature Screening in the General Population
clinical_study.official_title: The Application Value of Non-contact Infrared Thermometers in Temperature Screening in the General Population: a Real-world, Prospective, Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: The first epidemic of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV)-infected pneumonia(NCIP) in Wuhan, China, has attracted global attention because of its strong transmission ability and certain fatality. Analyzing the clinical data of hospitalized patients with 2019-nCoV infection, the current studies found that fever, fatigue and dry cough were common symptoms, and 43.8% of the patients showed fever before admission. Some scholars emphasize that the most effective means to control the outbreak are early detection, early isolation, early diagnosis and early treatment. In the face of the pressure that a large number of people need rapid screening and the deficiency that the forehead temperature measurement is easily affected by the environment, the investigators would like to explore the accuracy and advantages of wrist temperature measurement in different environments and conditions in this period. And determine the thresholds of non-contact infrared thermometer for the screening of patients with fever, in order to provide clinical indicators for further detection of patients with suspected fever.

primary_outcome.measure: The Comparison of accuracy between wrist temperature and forehead temperature.
primary_outcome.description: The investigators used non-contact infrared thermometers to measure the value of wrist and forehead temperature in patients, family members of patients, medical staff. They record the value of temperature in the population and environment temperature.
